New Records: The Dodgers have matched the MLB postseason record with 33 consecutive shutout innings, tying the 1966 Baltimore Orioles record
Key Match Events: Jack Flaherty pitched seven scoreless innings and allowed just two hits while striking out six in his start on Sunday
Mookie Betts hit a double in the eighth inning, clearing the bases and putting the Dodgers up 9-0
The Dodgers' pitching staff has now thrown 33 consecutive scoreless innings
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers' pitching strategy for Game 2 could be influenced by how Game 1 goes, with manager Dave Roberts saying it's a possibility they go with a bullpen game
The Mets are hoping to get three innings out of Kodai Senga in Game 1
The Dodgers are looking to extend their early lead and take a 1-0 series lead in the NLCS
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers have gone 33 postseason innings without allowing a single run, and are now just three wins away from reaching their first World Series since 2020
The team's pitching has been a key factor in their success, with Jack Flaherty and the bullpen combining to shut out the Mets
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in ideal weather conditions, with 72 degrees and clear skies in Los Angeles
The Dodgers' lineup featured a mix of veterans and young players, including Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts
The Mets' starting pitcher, Kodai Senga, struggled in his first outing of the series, issuing four walks and allowing three earned runs
